text: I'm VP of Cloud Delivery Services.

Pearson is an education company,
from assessments

to virtual learning to English language
learning.

As we were starting our migration
from data center to cloud,

we were seeing a gap in cloud knowledge
across the organization.
We really needed to focus on providing

an opportunity to upskill everyone,
and we really needed everyone

to have that base fundamental ability
to speak cloud.

We knew we had a challenge
that we had to cover
and weren't quite sure how to approach it.

Having the variety of offerings
from AWS Skills Guild really helped
personalize some of the learning experiences

for each person
so that they could pick a training
method that worked best for them.

We've run the program
now for two years and we've trained over
4,700 employees on all different levels.

Throughout the course
of doing the Learning2Work program,

we had individuals that reached out
and basically volunteered to help more.

We created a spinoff program specific
for some of their teams.
It's sped up our processes internally

and increased our ability to move faster
with our projects.

We've taken processes
that used to take six weeks

to execute and really reduced them down
to a number of days.

I don't think we would have
had the level of success that we did

if we didn't have the support from
the AWS Skills Guild team.
